name: core-tooltip
description:
The `core-tooltip` element creates a hover tooltip centered for the content it contains. It can be positioned on the top|bottom|left|right of content using the `position` attribute. To include HTML in the tooltip, include the `tip` attribute on the relevant content. Example: Hover over me. Example - positioning the tooltip to the right: Example - no arrow and showing by default: Example - disable the tooltip. ... Example - rich tooltip using the `tip` attribute:
Example of a rich information tooltip
Foo Bar - @baz
By default, the `tip` attribute specifies the HTML content for a rich tooltip. You can customize this attribute with the `tipAttribute` attribute:
Example of a rich information tooltip
...

label.name: label
label.description:
A simple string label for the tooltip to display. To display a rich
HTML tooltip instead, omit `label` and include the `tip` attribute
on a child node of `core-tooltip`.

show.name: show
show.description: Forces the tooltip to display. If `disabled` is set, this property is ignored.

position.name: position
position.description: Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

noarrow.name: noarrow
noarrow.description: If true, the tooltip an arrow pointing towards the content.

tipAttribute.name: tipAttribute
tipAttribute.description:
Customizes the attribute used to specify which content
is the rich HTML tooltip.
